meanings.definition: A flower, especially one cultivated for its beauty.
meanings.sent1: The bloom of the rose was vibrant and fragrant.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with colorful blooms in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The bloom on the daisy winked at the passing bees.
meanings.sent4: Each bloom in the bouquet was a unique masterpiece of nature.
meanings.sent5: The bloom of the sunflower turned towards the sun, seeking its warmth.

meanings.definition: To produce flowers; to be in flower.
meanings.sent1: In the summer, the garden will bloom with roses.
meanings.sent2: The cherry tree will bloom beautifully in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to bloom overnight, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile made her face bloom with happiness.
meanings.sent5: As the rain stopped, the fields began to bloom with wildflowers.

meanings.definition: To reach a state of health and beauty.
meanings.sent1: After a good night's sleep, she woke up feeling refreshed and ready to bloom.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the plant will bloom into a lush green beauty.
meanings.sent3: The idea seemed to bloom in his mind, growing stronger with each passing moment.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence began to bloom as she gained more experience.
meanings.sent5: The town started to bloom with new businesses and opportunities.
